column4: you want into a machine, can you 'ping' said machine and get a response?
no i cant ping it
is it firewalled?
yes
so, you want to ssh session with a machine that is firewalled?
not only ssh
can you ping the server?
strangely i'm getting a response back which i wasn't not even 15 mins ago
you can access the webpage because you are going into it via the public address
I can access the website and ssh if i use the public address
does your router disallow internal/lan ip's to connect? you obviously can connect via the public ip for the server, so its got to be an internal thing
let me check the mac controls brb
I cant see anything that would suggest that my router is blocking it
you said you ran zenmap, did it see the web/ubuntu-server?
if you are going to discount the router then you need to allow all and any contact within the network to take place
i tried with it set to allow and still nothing
if i use nmap -Pn 192.168.123.123 it says Starting Nmap 5.51 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2011-12-14 11:52 GMT Standard Time Nmap done: 1 IP address (0 hosts up) scanned in 0.74 seconds
run nmap on your public ip, see what is open to the world
port 2120 is not displayed even though I can access it. port 80 is displayed
hmm appears that ubuntu server is blocking local requests I turned off its firewall and it connects using lan ip address
yeap, firewall
